dedicated_server_interfaces_introduction: In this section you will find all the information related to the network interfaces of your server.
dedicated_server_interfaces_vrack_inform: Please note that by default no IP exists for the private network (vRack).  You must first create a private network (vRack), add your server to it, then configure your IP.
dedicated_server_interfaces_step_checker: Take a look at our guides
OLA now makes it possible to use both network connections of an OVH server together.
You can create a redundant private or public connection, while still being able to add additional bandwidth.
For the moment only available for the vRack private network
Take advantage of the Free launch offer billed at 0€ in lieu of 20€ less tax/month for the first 3 months.
Before configuring your option, make sure you have deleted all private networks connected to your network interfaces and any IP Fail Over
It's done, move on to next step.
It is now time to configure your interfaces, choose the desired mode and select your interfaces.
OLA is now activated and configured.
You must follow the procedure via IPMI KVM, detailed in the guide, in order for your network to be functional. Otherwise the configuration is not complete.
It's done, move on to next step.
Everything is ready! Your network interfaces are now configured.

If you wish to return to your original configuration, select "configure". You can also cancel your option, but don't forget to restore your configuration to the default configuration or your network will be inactive.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_activate: The configuration of your network interfaces was modified via OLA. If you wish to return to the default configuration, please change the OLA configuration.
dedicated_server_interfaces_ola_alert_co: Manual configuration via KVM IPMI will be required.
dedicated_server_interfaces_loading_mess: Interfaces are being configured. Please wait.
dedicated_server_interfaces_do_not_close: The operation can take some time. Please do not close this page.
dedicated_server_interfaces_detach_priva: Are you sure you want to detach the bulk "{{vrack}}" from the "{{interface}}" interface?
dedicated_server_interfaces_bandwith_des: Public bandwidth (to and from the Internet) is not limited at entry. You can increase public and private bandwidth by subscribing to an option
